body_html: Yes, but BFC is a recompacting allocator, while PoolAllocator, with a low miss toleration factor and auto_resize=true, is very much not. So, if you're using a large variety of different sizes, but only a few of them at once, BFC should not grow its memory region arbitrarily large.
body_text: Yes, but BFC is a recompacting allocator, while PoolAllocator, with a low miss toleration factor and auto_resize=true, is very much not.  So, if you're using a large variety of different sizes, but only a few of them at once, BFC should not grow its memory region arbitrarily large.
body: Yes, but BFC is a recompacting allocator, while PoolAllocator, with a low miss toleration factor and auto_resize=true, is very much not.  So, if you're using a large variety of different sizes, but only a few of them at once, BFC should not grow its memory region arbitrarily large.
